ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p:
Apple is looking for a dynamic, highly motivated Product Marketing Financial Analyst to support key Hardware Products. The Financial Analyst partners with various groups, manages extremely confidential information, has direct exposure to senior business leaders and is in a position to influence key strategic decisions at Apple.
This person needs to have outstanding verbal and written communication skills and be able to integrate wide arrays of data/information sources, build complex forecast and financial models to drive actionable business insights. We are looking for someone with strong analytical capabilities, superior financial / quantitative horsepower, and a deep interest in Apple’s products, business and strategy.

ul.li: Minimum 3-7 years of relevant work experience
Highly motivated, works well under pressure, organized, and proactive in leading projects from end-to-end
Ease with quantitative and financial analysis in a product context; able to work comfortably with incomplete information and dealing with ambiguity
Strong business acumen, high intellectual curiosity, and deep interest in Apple’s product, business and strategy
Outstanding verbal and written business communication skills
Sharp attention to detail with the ability to maintain the highest level of accuracy, yet understand the big picture
Ability to retrieve, analyze, and manipulate large datasets; experience with Tableau, R, Alteryx, SQL, and/or Business Objects a strong plus

div.p: This is an exciting opportunity that entails the following responsibilities: Collaborate closely with Product Marketing (including Business Management and Pricing), Operations and Engineering to find optimal intersections of information relevant to drive business decisions Formulate, architect, and build forecast & financial models based on a wide range of information available Integrate various datasets to create, present, and defend forecasts, scenarios, and other business insights to senior leadership Support Executive decisions related to revenue/gross margin scenarios and product lifecycle planning Build and maintain tools, presentations & reports to highlight relevant insights and track their evolution Work closely with the WWPM Finance and Pricing teams, and handle special projects and requests
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Engineering, or other quantitative field MBA; concentration in Finance is desirable
